name: C. Vus the Cossack and Strings
statement:
Vus the Cossack has two binary strings, that is, strings that consist
only of "" and "". We call these strings a and b. It is known that |b|
leq |a|, that is, the length of b is at most the length of a.The Cossack
considers every substring of length |b| in string a. Let’s call this
substring c. He matches the corresponding characters in b and c, after
which he counts the number of positions where the two strings are
different. We call this function f(b, c).For example, let b = 00110, and
c = 11000. In these strings, the first, second, third and fourth
positions are different.Vus the Cossack counts the number of such
substrings c such that f(b, c) is .For example, let a = 01100010 and b =
00110. a has four substrings of the length |b|: 01100, 11000, 10001,
00010. f(00110, 01100) = 2; f(00110, 11000) = 4; f(00110, 10001) = 4;
f(00110, 00010) = 1. Since in three substrings, f(b, c) is even, the
answer is 3.Vus can not find the answer for big strings. That is why he
is asking you to help him.
